intro: Trillium rhomboideum var. album, commonly known as the white trillium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its three broadly ovate, white to pale pink petals and three broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters and blooms in early spring. It has a rhizomatous root system and produces a single, erect stem. The flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant is often found in rich, moist woodlands.
